name: ABS (Acrylonitrile Butadiene Styrene)
summary: Engineering thermoplastic with excellent impact resistance and temperature performance.
description: ABS is a versatile engineering thermoplastic offering an excellent balance of mechanical properties, processability, and surface finish. With superior impact resistance even at low temperatures and good dimensional stability, ABS is ideal for demanding applications requiring durability and aesthetic appeal.

name: HIPS (High Impact Polystyrene)
summary: Stiff, impact-resistant material used for displays, trays, cosmetic packaging.
description: HIPS combines the rigidity and processability of polystyrene with enhanced impact strength through rubber modification. It offers excellent thermoforming characteristics, making it ideal for packaging and display applications.

name: GPPS (General Purpose Polystyrene)
summary: Good mechanical & electrical properties; used for disposable cups, trays.
description: GPPS is a transparent, rigid thermoplastic with excellent clarity and dimensional stability. Its ease of processing and good electrical insulation properties make it a popular choice for consumer goods.

name: PC (Polycarbonate)
summary: Transparent, high impact polymer used for lenses, medical devices, lighting.
description: Polycarbonate is an exceptionally tough transparent thermoplastic with outstanding impact resistance and heat resistance. It combines optical clarity with mechanical strength for demanding applications.

name: PBT (Polybutylene Terephthalate)
summary: Heat resistant engineering polymer for electrical/electronic use.
description: PBT is a semi-crystalline engineering thermoplastic with excellent electrical properties, dimensional stability, and chemical resistance. It maintains performance across a wide temperature range.

name: POM (Polyoxymethylene)
summary: Precision engineering polymer with low friction for mechanical parts.
description: POM, also known as acetal, offers exceptional dimensional stability, low friction, and excellent wear resistance. Its high stiffness and creep resistance make it ideal for precision mechanical components.

name: Nylon (PA6/66)
summary: Strong polymer for automotive & textile applications.
description: Nylon polyamides offer outstanding toughness, wear resistance, and thermal stability. These engineering thermoplastics are known for their strength and fatigue resistance in demanding environments.

name: PMMA (Acrylic)
description: PMMA (Polymethyl Methacrylate) is a transparent thermoplastic with excellent optical clarity and weather resistance. It offers glass-like transparency with lighter weight and better impact resistance.

name: PPS (Polyphenylene Sulfide)
summary: High temp & dimensional stability; electrical insulation.
description: PPS is a high-performance engineering thermoplastic with exceptional thermal stability, chemical resistance, and dimensional precision. It maintains properties in extreme environments.

name: SAN (Styrene Acrylonitrile)
summary: Good gloss & heat resistance for kitchen/household components.
description: SAN offers better chemical and heat resistance than standard polystyrene with improved rigidity and transparency. Its excellent surface gloss makes it ideal for aesthetic applications.

name: PP (Polypropylene)
summary: Versatile commodity plastic for packaging & films.
description: Polypropylene is one of the most versatile commodity plastics, offering excellent chemical resistance, fatigue resistance, and low density. Its balance of properties and cost makes it widely used.

name: HDPE (High-Density Polyethylene)
summary: High tensile strength & recyclable; used in bottles, pipes.
description: HDPE is a strong, rigid polymer with excellent chemical resistance and impact strength. It's highly recyclable and offers good barrier properties for a wide range of applications.

name: LLDPE (Linear Low-Density Polyethylene)
description: LLDPE offers superior puncture resistance and tensile strength compared to conventional LDPE. Its linear structure provides excellent film properties for demanding packaging applications.

name: PVC (Polyvinyl Chloride)
summary: Economical, chemical resistant polymer for pipes & flooring.
description: PVC is a versatile, durable polymer available in both rigid and flexible forms. Its excellent chemical resistance, fire resistance, and cost-effectiveness make it widely used in construction and industrial applications.
